title: 820-3115 B No green light on Magsafe
message:

Looks like bad U7000.
Before change it, post exact ohm values (measured onboard) for R7080/81 and R7085/86.

message:

can fully open Q7085 and Q7080?

title: 820-3115 B No green light on Magsafe
message:
Why did you replace U7000 so fast?
You had just a bad Q7080.

BTW, why do you post useless information???
"[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 15: CHGR_BMON[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 16: CHGR_BGATE[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 17: CHGR_CSO_N[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 18: CHGR_CSO_P"

U7000 could be bad, but never change something without reason.
You should change Q7080 first.[/B][/FONT]

"[FONT=Calibri][B]Q7085: shorted to ground at SOURCE (PINS1-3)[/B][/FONT]"
I'm sure this is not true!!!
Remove power when check diode mode to ground; also allow 10-15s before measure.

No start.

I will have to check PPBUS_G3H but before I took F7040 out I think it was pulsing as well.

My ideas now:

1) Q7950? could intermittent short on ALL_SYS_PWRGD be a factor?
2) I was going to start checking MOSFETS that were just before the coils next?...like Q7220
3) Also check U5010 with the SMC_RESET_L ?
4) Check U6990 because of a slight flicker on MAGSAFE green light?

title: 820-3115 B No green light on Magsafe
message:
I had left the board untouched for 12 hrs and I was actually getting a steady voltage on PPBUS_G3H for a while with a steady 0.35 amp draw on 18.5V power supply. But still no fan spin.

I had no idea what was going on.

As I handled the board, the pulsing started again on PPBUS_G3H measured at F7040 pad 2.
Fan ticking like it wants to start.


WTF? Should I ultrasonic clean this board? [HR][/HR]

title: 820-3115 B No green light on Magsafe
message:
You only needed two days to change mentioned components...

Missing image and backlight at same time?
Did you test external video?
Can you confirm USB activity at least?

title: 820-3115 B No green light on Magsafe
message:
I cannot see an image on the screen (used a flashlight behind apple logo)
No backlight

I watched Louis' videos on this and started checking the following:


LCD_BKLT_EN: 0V with display connected
Diode mode reading on LCD_BKLT_EN: 0.60V
LCDBKLT_EN: 12 V
LCD_BKLT_EN: 0 V
F9700 is good

Q9706
4: 12.4 V
1,2,5,6: 0 V
3: 12 V

Since Q9706 is a P type MOSFET that will only open when the voltage on the gate is much lower than the voltage on the source it seems like this is major issue.

C9782 diode mode is 0.4 V
R9788: 300KO
R9789: 146kO


I think Q9707 is not opening. No path to ground.
Q9706 never opens.

I think this LCD is never recognized to begin with.

Resistors on LVDS_DDC_DATA and LVDS_DDC_CLK are good (exactly on spec).
R9008 - 3.2kohms
R9009 - 3.15kohms

J9000 connector looks good.
No corrosion.
NO Liquid damage evidence.
All pins look good.
LVDS PINS:
pin 2,3: 0 V
pin 6 - 0.560 diode mode
pin 7 - 0.643 diode mode

If LCD_PWR_EN on U9000: 0V

SMC_LID: 3.45 V



I followed:

[URL="https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/1359-820-3115-no-backlight-missing-lcd_bklt_en/page2"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/for..._bklt_en/page2[/URL]


I will check with another LCD assembly.

Please remember that I am totally new to this.


R1981: 100K (LVDS_IG_BKL_ON = LCD_BKLT_EN)

LVDS_IG_BKL_ON is coming from U1800 so I think I may be screwed.
